heroImage.heroDescription: The way people consume news, sports and entertainment has changed. NZME is leading the charge by opening up media and putting New Zealanders at the centre of it.

Connected intelligence. Global Dairy Trade (GDT) is the world’s leading online dairy ingredients auction. With the launch of three new service lines; GDT Events, GDT Marketplace and GDT Insight, a new brand identity was needed which would bring these to life and collectively offer a definitive product suite for connecting the world of dairy trading.
A gift that shares an insight into how Designworks works together within the studio and in partnership with clients. Creating meaningful connections and brighter outcomes.
The launch of Farm Source signalled Fonterra's commitment to give the best, most advanced and trusted offering to the co-operative's farmers.

Before it fell in the 2011 earthquakes, the original Crowne Plaza Hotel was a Christchurch icon. Reborn through the bravery of its owners who have restored a former 17 floor 1980's office building in order to breathe new life into the city and restore the city's premier hotel. A premium 4.5 star hotel experience that put new energy into the Crowne Plaza brand as well as making it work locally, and igniting the theatre and drama of the Performing Arts Precinct.

Global dairy expertise. As the business-to-business ingredients brand of Fonterra, NZMP shares the grass-fed goodness of New Zealand dairy with the world. There’s much more to what they do than milk powder and lab coats, and their brand needed to reflect that.
Air New Zealand brings New Zealand to the world. They do more than carry people from A to B, they embody the Kiwi spirit of innovation, ambition and thinking outside the box.

In recent years, there has been a swell of support for the protection and rejuvenation of the Māori language. Air New Zealand has been a leading champion of this both internally and externally, and as part of their efforts, they needed a symbol that would recognise Te Reo Māori speakers within their organisation. Working together with master carver Clive Fugill, our job was to bring this badge to life.
Anchor has been an icon in New Zealand and around the world for over 90 years.

Over the past 10 years Silver Fern Farms have moved from being a separate set of entities to a unified producer developing innovative ways to bring the finest red meat products to the world. This demanded a re-think and total re-design of the offer - a new New Zealand standard.

Finding a true connection. Moana is the new name for Aotearoa Fisheries, a proud, highly successful producer and exporter of New Zealand seafood. Their true story needed to be told with reverence and authenticity.
The Supply Store is a busy dairy shop within Fonterra's Fanshawe Street headquarters. Designed to showcase and share the best of dairy produce, supplied fresh with quality and style.

Insights show that people's busier lives are shifting from less frequent and larger food shops to small shops more frequently, with fast wholesome meal solutions being a core need that wasn't currently being met. Foodstuffs saw the opportunity to think smart, think small, and create a small format store that could represent a fresh take on food retailing.
A revitalised website tells a rich story of provenance, nature and generations of fishing life in a genuine way.

Fonterra’s new head office is the home of the Dairy for Life story. A way to open up the world of co-operative to a broad range of visitors, creating an experience that is alive, constantly evolving and natural to discover.
When two agencies combined to the create The New Zealand Film Commission there was a need to organise and clarify storytelling under a single, cohesive identity.

For over 30 years, Coastguard New Zealand has been saving Kiwi lives at sea. In a world of rapidly moving technology and changing consumer expectations, it is vital that they remain relevant and able to continue doing what they do best. They needed an easy to use, accessible and effective digital tool to help them keep people safe out at sea.
A unique perspective. Malcolm Webb is a small firm working in the highly specialised area of technology and telecommunications law, with the knowledge of principal, Malcolm Webb, highly sought after.
& Sans was developed as a bespoke font for Designworks, moving the studio's identity forward by adding flex, creating simplicity and giving the design company's message room to breathe.

Black Dog Brew Co was born and bred in Wellington. It started as a small experimental brew lab to test boundaries, and has grown to become a big, bold new breed craft brewery that still refuses to conform to the norms.
A land like no other, Aotearoa’s biodiversity, geography and environment defines us as a people, and needs our care.
Creating an identity and total immersive experience for Semi-Permanent – the biggest event on Australasia’s creative calendar.

In 2013 Contact embarked on a category changing step-change. To be more than just an energy company. To be a company that understood the logistics and comfort required for Kiwis to run happy homes - and to switch on a culture to deliver it.
From alpine muster, to becoming just as at home in urban city living – this is the story of a kiwi classic evolving to lead a new era of “outdoors everyday”.
Kiwibank set about disrupting the banking sector, believing that New Zealand and New Zealanders deserve better. That upstart attitude was captured and brought to Kiwis at every connection.
Redefining the ANZAC spirit with new relevance to a new generation. The RSA story came right from the heart to connect with the hearts of all New Zealanders.
Deep in the heart of central Otago, the Lloyd family’s Te Kano estate lovingly captures life, land and legacy.

What better way to extend the massive collaborative talents of Weta, Te Papa Museum curators and content creators than an on-line digital experience of comparable immersive gravitas for Gallipoli: the Scale of our War.

MetService were ready to make a shift away from a state-owned, science-focused department to an outward facing, engaging organisation with a focus on providing accuracy, quality and consistency in weather forecasting.

This is how New Zealand introduces itself. A website to help all New Zealanders introduce themselves in Te Reo Māori, through Pepeha. Encouraging everyone to learn the stories behind their Pepeha and share them with pride.
